text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

You know, your step dad's,
cousin's husband died?
Oh?

Yeah, shark attack
at the aquarium.
Jeez.

Oh, and Carrie's friend from
junior high died in his sleep.

Here at night, slept and gone
in the morning, just like that.

Mom, you're like
a walking obituary.
Well, at least I'm walking.

I can't say the same for
Earl, my old gardener.

He ate a poisonous berry,
paralyzed, then he died.
That's, uh, interesting.

Not to change the
subject, but what have
you been doing all weekend?
I was on Facebook.

OK, I guess that's
something to do.

Someone shared a meme
about this soldier who died.
Oh crap, did I cry or what?

Mom, when's the last
time you left the house?
I was driving the other day.
OK, better.
And I saw a shooting.
He died, so sad.
I'm home.

Oh yeah, did you see the
sunset on the way home?
So gorgeous, so gorgeous.

You know, the only start to
get more beautiful as the sun

crawls slowly towards its
imminent death and life

as we know it is wiped out
of the universe forever.

Jeez, all you guys
talk about is death.
It's so depressing.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

Here you are, blueberry
pancakes, hold the berries.
Blair, no BB's?
What gives?
Yeah Blair, that's weird.

Earl's dead because
he ate berries.
Also, he's paralyzed.
Who the crap is Earl?

Gosh, Blair, you
are so depressing.
You remind me my parents.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
